member.name: T:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.AdoNetHelper
member.summary: Contains static helper methods for ADO.Net objects including Fast Serialization

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.AdoNetHelper.SerializeTypedDataTable(System.Data.DataTable)
member.summary:
Serializes a Typed DataTable to a byte[] containing only the data (ie no infrastructure)
The DataTable must be Typed and not a plain DataTable. It must also not have had any new columns added to it. In either of these cases, use SerializeDataTable instead.
member.returns: A byte[] containing the serialized data.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.AdoNetHelper.SerializeTypedDataSet(System.Data.DataSet)
member.summary:
Serializes a Typed DataSet to a byte[] containing only the data for each DataTable (ie no infrastructure)
The DataSet must be Typed and not a plain DataSet. It must also not have had any new columns/tables added to it. In either of these cases, use SerializeDataSet instead.
member.returns: A byte[] containing the serialized data.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.AdoNetHelper.SerializeDataSet(System.Data.DataSet)
member.summary: Serializes a DataSet to a byte[].
member.returns: A byte[] containing the serialized data.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.AdoNetHelper.SerializeDataTable(System.Data.DataTable)
member.summary: Serializes a DataTable to a byte[].
member.returns: A byte[] containing the serialized data.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.AdoNetHelper.SerializeSimpleTypedDataTable(System.Data.DataTable)
member.summary:
Serializes a simple Typed DataTable to a byte[] containing only data.
A simple Typed DataTable will have no Errors associated with the rows or columns and all rows should be Unchanged/Added (deserialized rows will always be Unchanged). Deleted rows will throw an exception. Designed for read-only tables which need to be serialized to a minumum size.
member.returns: A byte[] containing the serialized data.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.AdoNetHelper.DeserializeTypedDataSet(System.Type,System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Deserializes a Typed DataSet from a byte[] containing serialized data only.
The Type must match that from which the serialized data was originally obtained and it must have a parameterless constructor.
member.param: The Type of Typed DataSet to deserialize.
A byte[] containing the serialized data.
member.returns: A new DataSet of the requested type.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.AdoNetHelper.DeserializeTypedDataSet(System.Data.DataSet,System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Deserializes a Typed DataSet from a byte[] containing serialized data only.
The DataSet must be of the same type from which the serialized data was originally obtained.
member.param: The Typed DataSet to deserialize into.
A byte[] containing the serialized data.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.AdoNetHelper.DeserializeTypedDataTable(System.Type,System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Deserializes a Typed DataTable from a byte[] containing serialized data only.
The Type must match that from which the serialized data was originally obtained and it must have a parameterless constructor.
member.param: The Type of Typed DataTable to deserialize.
A byte[] containing the serialized data.
member.returns: A new DataTable of the requested type.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.AdoNetHelper.DeserializeTypedDataTable(System.Data.DataTable,System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Deserializes a Typed DataTable from a byte[] containing serialized data only.
The DataTable must be of the same type from which the serialized data was originally obtained.
member.param: The Typed DataTable to deserialize into.
A byte[] containing the serialized data.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.AdoNetHelper.DeserializeDataSet(System.Type,System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Deserializes a DataSet or Typed DataSet from a byte[].
The Type must match that from which the serialized data was originally obtained and it must have a parameterless constructor.
member.param: The Type of DataSet to deserialize.
A byte[] containing the serialized data.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.AdoNetHelper.DeserializeDataSet(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a new DataSet and populates it from originally serialized data.
member.param: A byte[] containing the serialized data.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.AdoNetHelper.DeserializeDataSet(System.Data.DataSet,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Deserializes data and infrastructure into the supplied DataSet.
member.param: A byte[] containing the serialized data.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.AdoNetHelper.DeserializeDataTable(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a new DataTable and populates it with previously serialized data.
member.param: A byte[] containing the serialized data.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.AdoNetHelper.DeserializeDataTable(System.Data.DataTable,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Populates the supplied DataTable with previously serialized data.
member.param: A byte[] containing the serialized data.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.AdoNetHelper.DeserializeSimpleTypedDataTable(System.Data.DataTable,System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Populates an existing Typed DataTable with row data previously serialized using SerializeSimpleTypedDataTable.
All rows will have Unchanged state even if they were Added or Modified at the time of serialization.
member.param: The DataTable into which to deserialize row data.
A byte[] containing the serialized data.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.AdoNetHelper.DeserializeSimpleTypedDataTable(System.Type,System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Create a new DataTable of the requested type and populates it with row data previously serialized using SerializeSimpleDataTable.
The type must have a parameterless constuctor and should be of the same type as previously serialized.
All rows will have Unchanged state even if they were Added or Modified at the time of serialization.
member.param: The Type of DataTable to create.
A byte[] containing the serialized data.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.AdoNetHelper.GetValuesFromRowVersion(System.Data.DataRow,System.Data.DataRowVersion)
member.summary: Returns an object[] of all the row values for the specified version
member.param: The row from which to extract values

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.AdoNetHelper.GetNullableDateTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Maps DateTime.MinValue to DBNull.Value.
member.returns: DBNull.Value if the DateTime is MinValue; otherwise the DateTime value.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.AdoNetHelper.GetKeyValuesFromRow(System.Data.DataRow)
member.summary: Gets an object[] holding the PrimaryKey column values. The Row must be in a DataTable.
member.param: The row from which to find values.
member.returns: An object[] holding the PrimaryKey values for the row, or an empty object[] if there is no PrimaryKey defined.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.AdoNetHelper.GetKeyValuesFromRow(System.Data.DataRow,System.Data.DataTable)
member.summary: Gets an object[] holding the values from the columns having the same names as those of the PrimaryKey columns from the supplied DataTable.
member.param: The row from which to find values.
The DataTable holding the PrimaryKey columns.
member.returns: An object[] holding the corresponding values for the row, or an empty object[] if there is no PrimaryKey defined.

The name of the column in which to look for unique values.
member.returns: An ArrayList containing the unique values.

member.param: The DataRows in which to look for unique values.
The ordinal of the column in which to look for unique values.
member.returns: An ArrayList containing the unique values.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.AdoNetHelper.GetDataSetDump(System.Data.DataSet,System.String)
member.summary:
Create a simple string dump of the contents (each table) of a DataSet.
Includes the key values for each row.
member.param: A description of the DataSet contents

member.name: T:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.IModifiedTypedDataSet
member.summary: Marker interface to signify that although the item is a Typed DataSet, it should be serialized as a plain DataSet since additional tables or columns may have been added to its schema

member.name: T:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter
member.summary:
A SerializationWriter instance is used to store values and objects in a byte array.
Once an instance is created, use the various methods to store the required data. ToArray() will return a byte[] containing all of the data required for deserialization. This can be stored in the SerializationInfo parameter in an ISerializable.GetObjectData() method.
As an alternative to ToArray(), if you want to apply some post-processing to the serialized bytes, such as compression, call AppendTokenTables first to ensure that the string and object token tables are appended to the stream, and then cast BaseStream to MemoryStream. You can then access the MemoryStream's internal buffer as follows:
writer.AppendTokenTables(); MemoryStream stream = (MemoryStream) writer.BaseStream; serializedData = MiniLZO.Compress(stream.GetBuffer(), (int) stream.Length);

member.name: F:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.DefaultCapacity
member.summary: Default capacity for the underlying MemoryStream

member.name: F:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.DefaultOptimizeForSize
member.summary: The Default setting for the OptimizeForSize property.

member.name: F:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.DateYearMask
member.summary: Section masks used for packing DateTime values

member.name: F:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.IsNegativeSection
member.summary: Section masks used for packing TimeSpan values

member.name: F:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.HighestOptimizable32BitValue
member.summary: Holds the highest int that can be optimized into less than the normal 4 bytes

member.name: F:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.HighestOptimizable64BitValue
member.summary: Holds the highest long that can be optimized into less than the normal 8 bytes

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a FastSerializer with the Default Capacity (1kb)

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a FastSerializer with the specified capacity

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates a FastSerializer around the specified stream Note: The stream must be seekable in this version to allow the token table offset to be written on completion
member.param: The seekable stream in which to store data

member.name: P:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.OptimizeForSize
member.summary: Gets or Sets a boolean flag to indicate whether to optimize for size (default) by storing data as packed bits or sections where possible. Setting this value to false will turn off this optimization and store data directly which increases the speed. Note: This only affects optimization of data passed to the WriteObject method and direct calls to the WriteOptimized methods will always pack data into the smallest space where possible.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Writes an ArrayList into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. Stored Size: 1 byte upwards depending on data content Notes: A null Arraylist takes 1 byte. An empty ArrayList takes 2 bytes. The contents are stored using WriteOptimized(ArrayList) which should be used if the ArrayList is guaranteed never to be null.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.Collections.BitArray)
member.summary: Writes a BitArray value into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. Stored Size: 1 byte upwards depending on data content Notes: A null BitArray takes 1 byte. An empty BitArray takes 2 bytes.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32)
member.summary: Writes a BitVector32 into the stream. Stored Size: 4 bytes.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Writes a DateTime value into the stream. Stored Size: 8 bytes

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.Guid)
member.summary: Writes a Guid into the stream. Stored Size: 16 bytes.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.Data.DataTable)
member.summary: Writes a DataTable into the stream.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.Data.DataSet)
member.summary: Writes a DataSet into the stream.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.IOwnedDataSerializable,System.Object)
member.summary: Allows any object implementing IOwnedDataSerializable to serialize itself into this SerializationWriter. A context may also be used to give the object an indication of what data to store. As an example, using a BitVector32 gives a list of flags and the object can conditionally store data depending on those flags.
member.param: The IOwnedDataSerializable object to ask for owned data
An arbtritrary object but BitVector32 recommended

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteObject(System.Object)
member.summary:
Stores an object into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. Stored Size: 1 byte upwards depending on type and/or content.
1 byte: null, DBNull.Value, Boolean
1 to 2 bytes: Int16, UInt16, Byte, SByte, Char,
1 to 4 bytes: Int32, UInt32, Single, BitVector32
1 to 8 bytes: DateTime, TimeSpan, Double, Int64, UInt64
1 or 16 bytes: Guid
1 plus content: string, object[], byte[], char[], BitArray, Type, ArrayList
Any other object be stored using a .Net Binary formatter but this should only be allowed as a last resort: Since this is effectively a different serialization session, there is a possibility of the same shared object being serialized twice or, if the object has a reference directly or indirectly back to the parent object, there is a risk of looping which will throw an exception.
The type of object is checked with the most common types being checked first. Each 'section' can be reordered to provide optimum speed but the check for null should always be first and the default serialization always last.
Once the type is identified, a SerializedType byte is stored in the stream followed by the data for the object (certain types/values may not require storage of data as the SerializedType may imply the value).
For certain objects, if the value is within a certain range then optimized storage may be used. If the value doesn't meet the required optimization criteria then the value is stored directly. The checks for optimization may be disabled by setting the OptimizeForSize property to false in which case the value is stored directly. This could result in a slightly larger stream but there will be a speed increate to compensate.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.String)
member.summary: Calls WriteOptimized(string). This override to hide base BinaryWriter.Write(string).

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Writes a TimeSpan value into the stream. Stored Size: 8 bytes

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.Type,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Stores a Type object into the stream. Stored Size: Depends on the length of the Type's name and whether the fullyQualified parameter is set. A null Type takes 1 byte.
member.param: true to store the AssemblyQualifiedName or false to store the FullName.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Writes an non-null ArrayList into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. Stored Size: 1 byte upwards depending on data content Notes: An empty ArrayList takes 1 byte.
member.param: The ArrayList to store. Must not be null.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.Collections.BitArray)
member.summary: Writes a BitArray into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. Stored Size: 1 byte upwards depending on data content Notes: An empty BitArray takes 1 byte.
member.param: The BitArray value to store. Must not be null.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32)
member.summary:
Writes a BitVector32 into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. Stored Size: 1 to 4 bytes. (.Net is 4 bytes) 1 to 7 bits takes 1 byte 8 to 14 bits takes 2 bytes 15 to 21 bits takes 3 bytes 22 to 28 bits takes 4 bytes ------------------------------------------------------------------- 29 to 32 bits takes 5 bytes - use Write(BitVector32) method instead
Try to order the BitVector32 masks so that the highest bits are least-likely to be set.
member.param: The BitVector32 to store. Must not use more than 28 bits.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Writes a DateTime value into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. Stored Size: 3 bytes to 7 bytes (.Net is 8 bytes) Notes: A DateTime containing only a date takes 3 bytes (except a .NET 2.0 Date with a specified DateTimeKind which will take a minimum of 5 bytes - no further optimization for this situation felt necessary since it is unlikely that a DateTimeKind would be specified without hh:mm also) Date plus hh:mm takes 5 bytes. Date plus hh:mm:ss takes 6 bytes. Date plus hh:mm:ss.fff takes 7 bytes.
member.param: The DateTime value to store. Must not contain sub-millisecond data.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Writes a Decimal value into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. Stored Size: 1 byte to 14 bytes (.Net is 16 bytes) Restrictions: None

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Write an Int32 value using the fewest number of bytes possible.
Only call this method if the value is known to be between 0 and 268,435,455 otherwise use Write(Int32 value)
member.remarks:
0x00000000 - 0x0000007f (0 to 127) takes 1 byte 0x00000080 - 0x000003FF (128 to 16,383) takes 2 bytes 0x00000400 - 0x001FFFFF (16,384 to 2,097,151) takes 3 bytes 0x00200000 - 0x0FFFFFFF (2,097,152 to 268,435,455) takes 4 bytes ---------------------------------------------------------------- 0x10000000 - 0x07FFFFFF (268,435,456 and above) takes 5 bytes All negative numbers take 5 bytes
Only call this method if the value is known to be between 0 and 268,435,455 otherwise use Write(Int32 value)
member.param: The Int32 to store. Must be between 0 and 268,435,455 inclusive.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.Int64)
member.param: The Int64 to store. Must be between 0 and 72,057,594,037,927,935 inclusive.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.String)
member.summary:
Writes a string value into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. Stored Size: 1 byte upwards depending on string length Notes: Encodes null, Empty, 'Y', 'N', ' ' values as a single byte Any other single char string is stored as two bytes All other strings are stored in a string token list:
The TypeCode representing the current string token list is written first (1 byte), followed by the string token itself (1-4 bytes)
When the current string list has reached 128 values then a new string list is generated and that is used for generating future string tokens. This continues until the maximum number (128) of string lists is in use, after which the string lists are used in a round-robin fashion. By doing this, more lists are created with fewer items which allows a smaller token size to be used for more strings.
The first 16,384 strings will use a 1 byte token. The next 2,097,152 strings will use a 2 byte token. (This should suffice for most uses!) The next 268,435,456 strings will use a 3 byte token. (My, that is a lot!!) The next 34,359,738,368 strings will use a 4 byte token. (only shown for completeness!!!)

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Writes a TimeSpan value into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. Stored Size: 2 bytes to 8 bytes (.Net is 8 bytes) Notes: hh:mm (time) are always stored together and take 2 bytes. If seconds are present then 3 bytes unless (time) is not present in which case 2 bytes since the seconds are stored in the minutes position. If milliseconds are present then 4 bytes. In addition, if days are present they will add 1 to 4 bytes to the above.
member.param: The TimeSpan value to store. Must not contain sub-millisecond data.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.Type)
member.summary: Stores a non-null Type object into the stream. Stored Size: Depends on the length of the Type's name. If the type is a System type (mscorlib) then it is stored without assembly name information, otherwise the Type's AssemblyQualifiedName is used.
member.param: The Type to store. Must not be null.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Write a UInt32 value using the fewest number of bytes possible. 0x00000000 - 0x0000007f (0 to 127) takes 1 byte 0x00000080 - 0x000003FF (128 to 16,383) takes 2 bytes 0x00000400 - 0x001FFFFF (16,384 to 2,097,151) takes 3 bytes 0x00200000 - 0x0FFFFFFF (2,097,152 to 268,435,455) takes 4 bytes ---------------------------------------------------------------- 0x10000000 - 0xFFFFFFFF (268,435,456 and above) takes 5 bytes
Only call this method if the value is known to be between 0 and 268,435,455 otherwise use Write(UInt32 value)
member.param: The UInt32 to store. Must be between 0 and 268,435,455 inclusive.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.UInt64)
member.param: The UInt64 to store. Must be between 0 and 72,057,594,037,927,935 inclusive.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.Boolean[])
member.summary: Writes a Boolean[] into the stream. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte. Calls WriteOptimized(Boolean[]).

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Writes a Byte[] into the stream. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.Char[])
member.summary: Writes a Char[] into the stream. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.DateTime[])
member.summary: Writes a DateTime[] into the stream. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.Decimal[])
member.summary: Writes a Decimal[] into the stream. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte. Calls WriteOptimized(Decimal[]).

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.Double[])
member.summary: Writes a Double[] into the stream. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.Single[])
member.summary: Writes a Single[] into the stream. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.Guid[])
member.summary: Writes a Guid[] into the stream. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Writes an Int32[] into the stream. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.Int64[])
member.summary: Writes an Int64[] into the stream. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes an object[] into the stream. Stored Size: 2 bytes upwards depending on data content Notes: A null object[] takes 1 byte. An empty object[] takes 2 bytes. The contents of the array will be stored optimized.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.SByte[])
member.summary: Writes an SByte[] into the stream. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.Int16[])
member.summary: Writes an Int16[]or a null into the stream. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte. Calls WriteOptimized(decimal[]).

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.TimeSpan[])
member.summary: Writes a TimeSpan[] into the stream. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.UInt32[])
member.summary: Writes a UInt32[] into the stream. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.UInt64[])
member.summary: Writes a UInt64[] into the stream. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write(System.UInt16[])
member.summary: Writes a UInt16[] into the stream. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.Boolean[])
member.summary: Writes an optimized Boolean[] into the stream using the fewest possible bytes. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte. Stored as a BitArray.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.DateTime[])
member.summary: Writes a DateTime[] into the stream using the fewest possible bytes. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.Decimal[])
member.summary: Writes a Decimal[] into the stream using the fewest possible bytes. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes a not-null object[] into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. Stored Size: 2 bytes upwards depending on data content Notes: An empty object[] takes 1 byte. The contents of the array will be stored optimized.
member.param: The object[] to store. Must not be null.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.Object[],System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes a pair of object[] arrays into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. The arrays must not be null and must have the same length The first array's values are written optimized The second array's values are compared against the first and, where identical, will be stored using a single byte. Useful for storing entity data where there is a before-change and after-change set of value pairs and, typically, only a few of the values will have changed.
member.param: The first object[] value which must not be null and must have the same length as values2
The second object[] value which must not be null and must have the same length as values1

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Writes an Int32[] into the stream using the fewest possible bytes. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.Int64[])
member.summary: Writes an Int64[] into the stream using the fewest possible bytes. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.TimeSpan[])
member.summary: Writes a TimeSpan[] into the stream using the fewest possible bytes. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.UInt32[])
member.summary: Writes a UInt32[] into the stream using the fewest possible bytes. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.UInt64[])
member.summary: Writes a UInt64[] into the stream using the fewest possible bytes. Notes: A null or empty array will take 1 byte.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteNullable(System.ValueType)
member.summary: Writes a Nullable type into the stream. Synonym for WriteObject().

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write``2(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{``0,``1})
member.summary: Writes a non-null generic Dictionary into the stream.
member.remarks:
The key and value types themselves are not stored - they must be supplied at deserialization time.
An array of keys is stored followed by an array of values.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.Write``1(System.Collections.Generic.List{``0})
member.summary: Writes a non-null generic List into the stream.
member.remarks:
The list type itself is not stored - it must be supplied at deserialization time.
The list contents are stored as an array.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteTypedArray(System.Array)
member.summary: Writes a null or a typed array into the stream.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.AppendTokenTables
member.summary: Writes the contents of the string and object token tables into the stream. Also write the starting offset into the first 4 bytes of the stream. Notes: Called automatically by ToArray(). Can be used to ensure that the complete graph is written before using an alternate technique of extracting a Byte[] such as using compression on the underlying stream.
member.returns: The length of the string and object tables.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.ToArray
member.summary:
Returns a byte[] containing all of the serialized data.
The current implementation has the data in 3 sections: 1) A 4 byte Int32 giving the offset to the 3rd section. 2) The main serialized data. 3) The serialized string tokenization lists and object tokenization lists.
Only call this method once all of the data has been serialized.
This method appends all of the tokenized data (string and object) to the end of the stream and ensures that the first four bytes reflect the offset of the tokenized data so that it can be deserialized first. This is the reason for requiring a rewindable stream.
Future implementations may also allow the serialized data to be accessed via 2 byte[] arrays. This would remove the requirement for a rewindable stream opening the possibility of streaming the serialized data directly over the network allowing simultaneous of partially simultaneous deserialization.
member.returns: A byte[] containing all serialized data.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteBytesDirect(System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Writes a byte[] directly into the stream. The size of the array is not stored so only use this method when the number of bytes will be known at deserialization time.
A null value will throw an exception
member.param: The byte[] to store. Must not be null.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteStringDirect(System.String)
member.summary: Writes a non-null string directly to the stream without tokenization.
member.param: The string to store. Must not be null.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteTokenizedObject(System.Object)
member.summary:
Writes a token (an Int32 taking 1 to 4 bytes) into the stream that represents the object instance. The same token will always be used for the same object instance.
The object will be serialized once and recreated at deserialization time. Calls to SerializationReader.ReadTokenizedObject() will retrieve the same object instance.
member.param: The object to tokenize. Must not be null and must not be a string.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.WriteTokenizedObject(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Writes a token (an Int32 taking 1 to 4 bytes) into the stream that represents the object instance. The same token will always be used for the same object instance.
When recreateFromType is set to true, the object's Type will be stored and the object recreated using Activator.GetInstance with a parameterless contructor. This is useful for stateless, factory-type classes.
When recreateFromType is set to false, the object will be serialized once and recreated at deserialization time.
Calls to SerializationReader.ReadTokenizedObject() will retrieve the same object instance.
member.param: The object to tokenize. Must not be null and must not be a string.
true if the object can be recreated using a parameterless constructor; false if the object should be serialized as-is

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.encodeTimeSpan(System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Encodes a TimeSpan into the fewest number of bytes. Has been separated from the WriteOptimized(TimeSpan) method so that WriteOptimized(DateTime) can also use this for .NET 2.0 DateTimeKind information. By taking advantage of the fact that a DateTime's TimeOfDay portion will never use the IsNegative and HasDays flags, we can use these 2 bits to store the DateTimeKind and, since DateTimeKind is unlikely to be set without a Time, we need no additional bytes to support a .NET 2.0 DateTime.
member.param: True if the TimeSpan is the TimeOfDay from a DateTime; False if a real TimeSpan.
The intial data for the BitVector32 - contains DateTimeKind or 0

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.checkOptimizable(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary:
Checks whether an optimization condition has been met and throw an exception if not.
This method has been made conditional on THROW_IF_NOT_OPTIMIZABLE being set at compile time. By default, this is set if DEBUG is set but could be set explicitly if exceptions are required and the evaluation overhead is acceptable. If not set, then this method and all references to it are removed at compile time.
Leave at the default for optimum usage.
member.param: An expression evaluating to true if the optimization condition is met, false otherwise.
The message to include in the exception should the optimization condition not be met.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.write7bitEncodedSigned32BitValue(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Stores a 32-bit signed value into the stream using 7-bit encoding.
The value is written 7 bits at a time (starting with the least-significant bits) until there are no more bits to write. The eighth bit of each byte stored is used to indicate whether there are more bytes following this one.
See Write(Int32) for details of the values that are optimizable.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.write7bitEncodedSigned64BitValue(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Stores a 64-bit signed value into the stream using 7-bit encoding.
The value is written 7 bits at a time (starting with the least-significant bits) until there are no more bits to write. The eighth bit of each byte stored is used to indicate whether there are more bytes following this one.
See Write(Int64) for details of the values that are optimizable.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.write7bitEncodedUnsigned32BitValue(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Stores a 32-bit unsigned value into the stream using 7-bit encoding.
The value is written 7 bits at a time (starting with the least-significant bits) until there are no more bits to write. The eighth bit of each byte stored is used to indicate whether there are more bytes following this one.
See Write(UInt32) for details of the values that are optimizable.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.write7bitEncodedUnsigned64BitValue(System.UInt64)
member.summary:
Stores a 64-bit unsigned value into the stream using 7-bit encoding.
The value is written 7 bits at a time (starting with the least-significant bits) until there are no more bits to write. The eighth bit of each byte stored is used to indicate whether there are more bytes following this one.
See Write(ULong) for details of the values that are optimizable.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.writeObjectArray(System.Object[])
member.summary:
Writes the values in the non-null object[] into the stream.
Sequences of null values and sequences of DBNull.Values are stored with a flag and optimized count. Other values are stored using WriteObject().
This routine is called by the Write(object[]), WriteOptimized(object[]) and Write(object[], object[])) methods.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.writeTypeCode(SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializedType)
member.summary:
Stores the specified SerializedType code into the stream.
By using a centralized method, it is possible to collect statistics for the type of data being stored in DEBUG mode.
Use the DumpTypeUsage() method to show a list of used SerializedTypes and the number of times each has been used. This method and the collection code will be optimized out when compiling in Release mode.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.writeTypedArray(System.Array,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Internal implementation to write a non-null typed array into the stream.
member.remarks:
Checks first to see if the element type is a primitive type and calls the correct routine if so. Otherwise determines the best, optimized method to store the array contents.
An array of object elements never stores its type.
member.param: The non-null typed array to store.
True if the type should be stored; false otherwise

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.isTypeRecreatable(System.Type)
member.summary: Checks whether instances of a Type can be created.
member.remarks: A Value Type only needs to implement IOwnedDataSerializable. A Reference Type needs to implement IOwnedDataSerializableAndRecreatable and provide a default constructor.
member.returns: true if the Type is recreatable; false otherwise.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.arrayElementsAreSameType(System.Object[],System.Type)
member.summary: Checks whether each element in an array is of the same type.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.writeTypedArrayTypeCode(System.Collections.BitArray,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes the TypeCode for the Typed Array followed by the number of elements.

member.name: T:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.SingletonTypeWrapper
member.summary: Private class used to wrap an object that is to be tokenized, and recreated at deserialization by its type.

member.name: T:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter.UniqueStringList
member.summary:
Provides a faster way to store string tokens both maintaining the order that they were added and providing a fast lookup.
Based on code developed by ewbi at http://ewbi.blogs.com/develops/2006/10/uniquestringlis.html

member.name: T:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationReader
member.summary:
A SerializationReader instance is used to read stored values and objects from a byte array.
Once an instance is created, use the various methods to read the required data. The data read MUST be exactly the same type and in the same order as it was written.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationReader.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Creates a SerializationReader using a byte[] previous created by SerializationWriter
A MemoryStream is used to access the data without making a copy of it.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationReader.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates a SerializationReader based on the passed Stream.
member.param: The stream containing the serialized data

member.name: P:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationReader.BytesRemaining
member.summary:
Returns the number of bytes or serialized remaining to be processed. Useful for checking that deserialization is complete.
Warning: Retrieving the Position in certain stream types can be expensive, e.g. a FileStream, so use sparingly unless known to be a MemoryStream.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationReader.ReadOptimizedObjectArray(System.Type)
member.summary:
Returns an object[] from the stream that was stored optimized. The returned array will be typed according to the specified element type and the resulting array can be cast to the expected type. e.g. string[] myStrings = (string[]) reader.ReadOptimizedObjectArray(typeof(string));
An exception will be thrown if any of the deserialized values cannot be cast to the specified elementType.
member.param: The Type of the expected array elements. null will return a plain object[].

member.summary: Allows an existing object, implementing IOwnedDataSerializable, to retrieve its owned data from the stream.
member.param: An optional, arbitrary object to allow context to be provided.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationReader.ReadTokenizedObject
member.summary: Returns the object associated with the object token read next from the stream.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationReader.decodeTimeSpan(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Returns a TimeSpan decoded from packed data. This routine is called from ReadOptimizedDateTime() and ReadOptimizedTimeSpan().
This routine uses a parameter to allow ReadOptimizedDateTime() to 'peek' at the next byte and extract the DateTimeKind from bits one and two (IsNegative and HasDays) which are never set for a Time portion of a DateTime.
member.param: The first of two always-present bytes.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationReader.readTypedArrayOptimizeFlags(SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializedType)
member.summary: Creates a BitArray representing which elements of a typed array are serializable.
member.returns: A BitArray denoting which elements are serializable.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationReader.processObject(SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializedType)
member.summary: Returns an object based on supplied SerializedType.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationReader.processArrayTypes(SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializedType,System.Type)
member.summary: Determine whether the passed-in type code refers to an array type and deserializes the array if it is. Returns null if not an array type.
member.param: The Type of array element; null if to be read from stream.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationReader.readTokenizedString(System.Int32)

member.name: T:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.IOwnedDataSerializable
member.summary: Allows a class to save/retrieve their internal data to/from an existing SerializationWriter/SerializationReader.

member.name: M:SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.IOwnedDataSerializable.SerializeOwnedData(SimmoTech.Utils.Serialization.SerializationWriter,System.Object)
member.summary: Lets the implementing class store internal data directly into a SerializationWriter.
member.param: Optional context to use as a hint as to what to store (BitVector32 is useful)

member.summary: Lets the implementing class retrieve internal data directly from a SerializationReader.
